trailingComments.value:
* * @desc * Instructs the {@link @serenity-js/core/lib/screenplay/actor~Actor} to * perform a double-click on a given Web element. * * @example Example widget * *
*
    *
  • User12345
    • *
  • tester@example.org
    • *
*
* *
*
* * @example Lean Page Object describing the widget * import { by, Target } from '@serenity-js/webdriverio'; * * class UserProfile { * static displayName = Target.the('display name') * .located(by.id('display-name')); * static emailAddress = Target.the('email address') * .located(by.id('email-address')); * static editor = Target.the('editor') * .located(by.id('editor')); * } * * @example Double-clicking on an element * import { actorCalled } from '@serenity-js/core'; * import { BrowseTheWeb, DoubleClick, isVisible, Enter, Text, Wait } from '@serenity-js/webdriverio'; * import { Ensure, equals, not } from '@serenity-js/assertions'; * * actorCalled('Dorothy') * .whoCan(BrowseTheWeb.using(browser)) * .attemptsTo( * DoubleClick.on(UserProfile.displayName), * Wait.until(UserProfile.editor, isVisible()), * * Enter.theValue('New username').into(UserProfile.editor), * * Ensure.that(Text.of(UserProfile.displayName), equals('New username')), * Ensure.that(UserProfile.editor, not(isVisible())) * ); * * @see {@link Target} * * @extends {WebElementInteraction}

*
     * @param {Answerable<Element<'async'>>} target
     *  The element to be double-clicked on
